item.title: 3D plots as in Mathematica
item.description:
Sometimes you just need to visualize a shape of a function. Ideally this should be fast, intuitive and simple. I always liked the simplicity of Wolfram Mathematica 3D plots. Just do

Plot3D[Sin[x*y], {x, 0, 5}, {y, 0, 5}]

and you have a very nice plot. Which is, by the way, interactive (as long as you stay in Mathematica)

item.title: Multiple comparison
item.description:
Let say you have a data set with many columns and you would like to see if there are is any statistically significant dependence between some of the parameters. Just write a script and find those with p < 0.05 - right?

Actually no… You are almost guarantied to have at least 5% of those columns to be statistically significantly correlated. This is known as a “multiple comparison” problem.
